Project Manager Job at PCP Construction Nigeria Limited

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

            
    




	The Project Manager ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects on time, within scope, and within budget, while ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and company objectives.
	The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, excellent communication abilities, and proven experience managing cross-functional teams, clients, and contractors to ensure projects are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.


Key Responsibilities


	Project Planning: Define project scope, objectives, deliverables, timelines, and budgets; allocate resources effectively.
	Develop and manage project plans, timelines, and budgets
	Coordinate with architects, engineers, contractors, and clients
	Monitor progress and adjust schedules as needed
	Ensure safety standards are met on site
	Communicating project status to stakeholders
	Resolve issues and manage risks throughout the project lifecycle
	Team Coordination: Lead and motivate teams, delegate tasks, and monitor performance.
	Risk Management: Identify potential risks, implement mitigation strategies, and resolve project challenges.
	Quality Assurance: Ensure all deliverables meet industry and company quality standards.
	Stakeholder Communication: Maintain strong relationships with clients and internal stakeholders; provide regular updates and manage expectations.
	Documentation: Maintain accurate project records, including plans, status reports, and meeting notes.
	Timeline Management: Track milestones, monitor progress, and implement adjustments as needed.
	Closure & Evaluation: Finalize documentation, obtain client/stakeholder acceptance, and capture lessons learned.
	Stakeholder Coordination:Act as the primary liaison, coordinating with clients, design teams, engineers, contractors, and regulatory authorities.
	Design Oversight:Oversee the development of design concepts, construction documentation, and technical specifications to meet project goals.
	Team Leadership:Lead and mentor project teams, including internal staff and external consultants, to ensure productivity and successful delivery.
	Quality and Compliance:Ensure projects adhere to aesthetic and technical standards, as well as all relevant building codes, safety, and environmental regulations.
	Track project performance using appropriate tools, KPIs, and performance frameworks.


Requirements, Essential Skills & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Project Management, Civil Engineering, or related field
	Certifications like PMP (Project Management Professional) or CCM (Certified Construction Manager) are highly valued
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in construction or project management roles
	Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies (e.g., MS Project, AutoCAD.
	Technical Knowledge: Strong understanding of architectural design principles and construction processes.
	Project Management Expertise: Proficient in project planning, scheduling, and budgeting.
	Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills to effectively liaise with a diverse range of stakeholders.
	Organizational Skills: Ability to manage multiple projects, tasks, and teams simultaneously.
	Problem-Solving: Capacity to identify and resolve design and construction issues promptly.
	Regulatory Knowledge: Familiarity with building codes, zoning laws, and other relevant regulations.


Method of Application

HSE Officer Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with an office located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Compile safety programs.
	Regularly inspect equipment and the site.
	Practice safe working techniques.
	Implement and maintain health and safety standards.
	Establish a cordial and professional relationship with employees.
	Maintain compliance with all safety regulations.
	Conduct regular toolbox meetings to share best practice techniques.
	Standardize health and safety in order to remain consistent.
	Identify hazardous waste and dispose of it correctly.
	Compile and maintain relevant registers to ensure compliance.
	Document staff information, minutes of meetings, and reports compiled for management.
	Ensure Technicians are wearing the correct PPE.
	Monitor technicians.


Relevant work experience/Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / HND qualification with 3 - 5 years of work experience.
	Certification in HSE, ISO and NEBOSH is a plus.


Salary
N180,000 - N210,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment3@ekomaintenance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
